SEARCH
Module FloWeekTracker
Package com.floweektracker.service

Class TasksService

java.lang.Object
com.floweektracker.service.TasksService
public class TasksService extends Object
Represents a service for handling tasks. This class is a singleton and is used to store and manage tasks.

Fields: service, schedule, plannerRepository

CRUD methods: addTask(SingleTask), deleteTask(SingleTask), editTask(SingleTask, SingleTask), savePlanner()

Getter methods: getTaskByEventTime(WeekDays, LocalTime), getTasksFromWeekday(WeekDays)

Other methods: initSchedule(), collectSortedTimes(), countPoints(WeekDays, Function), isTaskInSchedule(SingleTask), isTimeOccupied(SingleTask)

    • addTask

      public boolean addTask(SingleTask task)
      Add task to the schedule. If the task is null or the time is occupied, return false.
      Parameters:
      task - represents the task to be added
      Returns:
      true if task is successfully added to schedule, otherwise false.
      See Also:
      • isTimeOccupied(SingleTask)
      • isTaskInSchedule(SingleTask)
      • TaskAddingDialogController

    • deleteTask

      Delete task from the schedule. If the task is not exist or the time is not occupied, return false.
      Parameters:
      task - represents the task to be deleted
      Returns:
      true if task is successfully deleted, otherwise false.
      See Also:
      • isTimeOccupied(SingleTask)
      • isTaskInSchedule(SingleTask)

    • editTask

      public boolean editTask(SingleTask task, SingleTask editedTask)
      Edits a task in the schedule by replacing the old task with a new task. The operation involves deleting the old task and adding the new one. If any of the following conditions are met, the method returns false:
      • Either the old task or the new task is null.
      • The old task and new task are identical.
      • The old task is not found in the schedule.
      • The new task is already in the schedule.
      The method attempts to delete the old task and add the new task. If the addition fails, it will attempt to roll back.
      Parameters:
      task - represents an old task to be replaced.
      editedTask - represents a new task to be added.
      Returns:
      true if the task is successfully edited, otherwise false.
      See Also:
      • isTaskInSchedule(SingleTask)
      • deleteTask(SingleTask)
      • addTask(SingleTask)
      • DialogUtils.rollback(SingleTask, Consumer, Function)
      • MainPanelController
      • TaskEditingDialogController

    • collectSortedTimes

      public TreeSet<LocalTime> collectSortedTimes()
      Collects all the local times from the schedule into a sorted set
      Returns:
      a TreeSet with all the local times in the schedule. The set is sorted in ascending order.
      See Also:
      • PlannerView.createPlannerModel()

    • countPoints

      public int countPoints(WeekDays weekday, Function<SingleTask,Byte> singleTaskMethod)
      Counts the points of the tasks in the schedule based on the given Function. The function takes a task and returns the points of the task. The points are then summed up. The method returns the sum of points of all the tasks in the given weekday.
      Parameters:
      weekday - the weekday to count the points from
      singleTaskMethod - the function to apply to each task
      Returns:
      the sum of points of all the tasks in the given weekday
      See Also:
      • PlannerService.actualizeSummarizeForWeekday(WeekDays)
      • PlannerView.buildPointsRow()

    • isTaskInSchedule

      public boolean isTaskInSchedule(SingleTask task)
      Checks if the given task is in the schedule. Returns false if task is null.
      Parameters:
      task - a given task to check
      Returns:
      true if the task is in the schedule, otherwise false
      See Also:
      • TaskAddingDialogController.isTaskAdded(SingleTask)
